name: OMG: One Million Galaxies - Interactive Demo of a Citizen Science Programme
description:
Ever wondered how to analyse galaxy features from deep imaging surveys? Join us in the exciting "OMG: One Million Galaxies" workshop, where you'll work with real data from the 8-meter Subaru telescope! This citizen science project, developed by the Indian Institute of Astrophysics (IIA) in collaboration with the Pune Knowledge Cluster and led by Prof. Sudhanshu Barway, invites you to dive into the cosmos.
With telescopes worldwide generating terabytes to petabytes of data every night, astronomy is more accessible than ever. Citizen science empowers anyone with a passion for space to explore multi-wavelength data, contributing to groundbreaking discoveries. OMG, one of India's key initiatives, engages volunteers in understanding the science behind galaxy pattern recognition.

Participants are required to bring their personal laptops for this programme.

name: Exploring the Universe since 1786: A History of Modern Astronomy in India through IIA's eyes
description:
Curious about the fascinating history of modern astronomy in India? From a private observatory in Chennai in 1786 to the establishment of the Madras Observatory by the East India Company in 1792 and its century of achievements, India’s astronomical journey is captivating. The founding of the Kodaikanal Observatory in 1899 to study the Sun led to the formation of the Indian Institute of Astrophysics (IIA) in 1971, now located in Koramangala, Bengaluru.
Join facilitators from IIA as they explore its rich and diverse roots, shaped by colonial endeavours, European scientific advancements, indigenous knowledge, and the global spread of scientific practices. They will take you on a journey through key milestones in this history, focusing on IIA’s role, from the Madras Observatory’s discoveries to the two 1800s instruments loaned to Sci560. Along the way, you'll uncover the discovery of Helium, the intersection of traditional and modern astronomical calculations, and the longest continuous solar observations. Don’t miss this opportunity to delve into India's astronomical legacy!

name: The Sun, Space Weather, and India’s Solar Quest
description: Have you ever wondered how the Sun influences life on Earth beyond just providing light and warmth? The Sun's magnetic activities, such as solar flares and coronal mass ejections, can cause space weather events that disrupt satellites, power grids, and communication systems. Understanding the science behind space weather and its effects on modern technology is key to grasping Earth’s relationship with the Sun. India has made significant contributions to solar research—from over a century of observations at the Kodaikanal Solar Observatory to the Aditya-L1 mission and the proposed National Large Solar Telescope—highlighting the need for continued solar exploration. Join Jayant Joshi to explore the Sun, space weather, and India’s efforts to understand our nearest star.

name: Into the Cosmos: The Ultimate Astronomy Quiz
description: Are you an astronomy enthusiast or a passionate stargazer? Join the facilitators of Indian Institute of Astrophysics for an exciting quiz that will challenge your understanding of the cosmos! This quiz will feature questions on the latest astronomical discoveries, iconic telescopes, renowned astronomers, and famous celestial objects. Form a team of three people and dive into the wonders of the universe. Whether you're a seasoned space buff or a curious learner, this quiz is designed for all ages to explore the mysteries of our cosmos!
